text:
In Russia, the law on sovereign Runet entered into force. What is wrong with him?
01 Nov 2019, 10:56 by Vladislav Voitenko
On November 1, the law on sovereign Runet entered into force in Russia. We tell what we are preparing for and why it will not work now.


Image: Sergey Yolkin for DW

The law on sovereign Runet, which entered into force, implies empowering Roskomnadzor to manage the Russian segment of the Internet - the agency should receive a full map of traffic exchange points, which will subsequently allow providers to block channels to any Internet resource under the law. If a ‚Äúthreat from the outside‚Äù appears, Roskomnadzor will take over the entire centralized management of the Runet and will be able to block access to a particular resource without warning.
How it should work


Photo: LJ

We are not talking about any restrictions on the Internet. We must ensure the reliable functioning of the Runet, the Russian segment of the Internet. That's what this law is aimed at, only this, ‚Äùsaid Russian President Vladimir Putin.
The law obliges telecom operators to install on their networks technical means of countering threats that will allow filtering traffic and restricting access to prohibited sites. Such equipment includes a system for deep filtering traffic (Deep Packet Inspection - DPI, "deep packet analysis"). The equipment should be provided to providers by Roskomnadzor, and its installation and maintenance should be carried out at the expense of budget funds.
DPI technology works as follows: the provider installs the appropriate software and hardware complex, which analyzes all the traffic passing through, highlighting specific packages that are specific to specific Internet services. Further, the complex cuts off unwanted traffic. It is assumed that the locks will become better, because Roskomnadzor will not have to think about how this or that address range is used.
In theory, with the start of the sovereign Runet law, it will become a bit more difficult for Internet resources to deal with blocking, because, for example, switching any blocked site to another domain name may not affect the situation. First of all, according to the head of Roskomnadzor, the law will help in the fight against resources prohibited in Russia, including the Telegram messenger. However, for this, the Russian authorities need to solve one difficult problem.
The law has entered into force, but it cannot take effect.


Photo: Sergey Lantyukhov, News.ru

The law is not about restrictions, but about the protection of the Runet. Is there a great threat of a nuclear war in the world? There may be different assessments, however, if there is such a threat, then the Russian Federation, as a sovereign state, must oppose this with certain military capabilities. Similarly, with the Internet. This is a huge branch of the Russian economy, said Andrei Klishas, one of the authors of the law.
The thing is that the full installation of the necessary equipment for the sovereignty of the Runet throughout the country will require at least a year. About this reporters "b" anonymously told one of the participants in testing technical means of countering threats. An unnamed source close to the presidential administration of Russia, said that the law would be "not in fact throughout the territory."
Moreover, the creator of the monitoring of the registry of prohibited sites of Roskomnadzor Usher2.club Philip Kulin emphasizes that all the necessary by-laws have not been adopted to install the necessary equipment to implement the law. Of the 26 necessary documents, only 7 have been published so far, of which 5 have entered into force on November 1, and 2 subparagraphs - on encrypting traffic with Russian cryptography and on using the national domain name system - will only work on January 1, 2021.
Nevertheless, testing of deep traffic filtering systems has been conducted in Russia over the past few months. But not without jambs. For example, due to the shortcomings of this technology, in March, Yandex service malfunctions occurred, as Alexey Sokolov, director of network infrastructure development, told the company. According to him, in the course of ‚Äúcertain exercises,‚Äù Roskomnadzor drove traffic through the current DPI systems at that time.
From words about a possible victory over Telegram, which the Russian authorities have not been able to block for more than a year and a half, Roskomnadzor got down to business. At the end of September, the agency began to introduce DPI deep traffic filtering systems in the Urals - the authorities intend to equip the entire Ural Federal District with appropriate equipment by the end of 2019.
Equipment for the implementation of the law in the Urals is provided by the Data - Processing and Automation Center company, which is headed by the former head of Nokia in Russia and ex-deputy communications minister Rashid Ismailov. At that time, the systems were already at the disposal of telecom operators providing home Internet services in Yekaterinburg. They fear in Roskomnadzor the only thing - the incorrect operation of the equipment. In this case, experts prepared a mechanism that disables traffic filtering.
There is money (it turns out!), But there is no result


Photo: Mikhail Tereshchenko, TASS

It should influence the subjects of the information space in such a way that they begin to comply with Russian legislation. The task is complex, multifaceted, experiments are continuing. It's not just about DPI. Of course, the technology of deep analysis of packages is necessary, but this is only part of the equipment that is required to solve problems, ‚Äùsaid the head of Roskomnadzor Alexander Zharov.
In mid-October, a user of the Rutreker torrent tracker blocked in Russia encountered incorrect program operation to bypass GoodbyeDPI DPI locks. Probably, the application ceased to fulfill its function due to the introduction of EcoDPI from rdp.ru on the networks of Rostelecom in the Murmansk Region. The GoodbyeDPI logs indicated that the provider uses a full DPI.
Does this really tell us that the results of work on the implementation of the sovereign Runet law are purely positive? The same ‚Äúfull-fledged DPI" that a user from the Murmansk region has encountered keeps track of links even inside proxy servers, therefore, to bypass such a block, you must use any encrypted connection with traffic masking and protocol encapsulation.
As an example of a successful bypass of the lock in the case of the start of the systems launched as part of the implementation of the sovereign Runet law, we can use the method of masking traffic under the usual TLS (transport layer security), a protocol that provides secure data transfer between nodes on the Internet. In short: switching from proxy servers to fake TLS makes the domain invisible to the provider, and if the server is in the cloud from, for example, Google and the domain of the same company is used for coordination (Google.com, - approx. CD), then in fact, the provider will receive information about the conditional service Google, working on the HTTPS / TLS protocol. Will Roskomnadzor just block Google and half the Internet? üòÇ
Former Telegram special director Anton Rosenberg told Durov‚Äôs Code that using deep traffic filtering systems is unlikely to help the Russian authorities completely isolate themselves from the global Internet, including blocking Telegram. The only thing that the Durov brothers messenger can face is the complication of the fight against blocking proxies:

DPI will not help block Telegram, since the latter can mask its traffic under HTTPS, encapsulate in VPN and other protocols. Moreover, it can change the scheme more quickly than equipment manufacturers. But if this equipment can block individual addresses in real time, this can complicate the task of Telegram a bit, since the addresses of proxy servers can be blocked more quickly. However, the performance and price of such solutions also raises big questions.

The big question is the cost of implementing the law on sovereign Runet. On the one hand, domestic companies support this initiative, because the law ‚Äúwill allow the industry to feel more relaxed,‚Äù on the other hand, is it advisable to spend huge amounts of money on the fact that it‚Äôs not a fact that it will work as intended by Messrs. Senators Andrei Klishas , Lyudmila Bokova, as well as State Duma deputy Andrei Lugov?
Under the law, the government allocated 1.8 billion rubles to create a public communications network management center. Officially, in 2019 it is planned to spend 597 million rubles on the implementation of the sovereign Runet, in 2020 - 699 million, and in 2021 - 546 million rubles. The funds will be distributed in stages: 95% of subsidies will be allocated for the development of appropriate software and hardware products, and no more than 50% from 2022, while more money will be spent on employees of the Center from 3% in 2019 to 30% from 2022 year.
